title: JPMorgan’s New Manhattan Headquarters to Be All Electric Powered
sub_head: Bank says 1,388-foot skyscraper on Park Avenue to rely on hydroelectric power source
body:
JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s new Manhattan headquarters will rely on a hydroelectric power source, making the 1,388-foot skyscraper the tallest and largest New York building to go all electric.
The office tower will operate with net-zero emissions, the company said Thursday. JPMorgan, which is the largest U.S. bank, plans to consolidate a number of its New York offices after the Norman Foster-designed building on Park Avenue is completed around 2025.
